intro: Hieracium austriniforme, commonly known as the Australian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, facilitating wind dispersal of its seeds. Hieracium austriniforme is often found in coastal and inland regions, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
